content.description: Start with your hands on the great right facing holds on the far right-hand side of the Boxcar boulder.  Work up and right to top out.
content.location:
The extreme right side of the Boxcar boulder.                

The Blasted Rock and Boxcar Boulder: 1. Blasted Rock (V1), 1a. Blasted Rock Variation (V0), 1b. Blasted Rock Variation (V0), 2. Blasted Rock Slab (V0), 3. Boxcar Arete (V8), 4. Unnamed BP #1 (V0), 5. Unnamed BP #2 (V2+), 6. Unnamed BP #3 (V1), 7. Unnamed BP #4 (V3), 8. Unnamed BP #5 (V2), 9. Unnamed BP #6 (V0), 10. Unnamed BP #7 (V0), 11. Boxcar Boulder Problem (V4), 11a. Boxcar's Low Traverse (V5), 11b. Extended Boxcar Traverse (V6)

content.description: The easiest of the three dyno problems from the smile, this is still no gimme.  Start with your hands on the right side of the smilelike feature on the right side of the Boxcar boulder.  Find what minuscule feet you can, and power up to the top.
content.location:
Starts at the right side of the smilelike feature on the Boxcar boulder.                

The Blasted Rock and Boxcar Boulder: 1. Blasted Rock (V1), 1a. Blasted Rock Variation (V0), 1b. Blasted Rock Variation (V0), 2. Blasted Rock Slab (V0), 3. Boxcar Arete (V8), 4. Unnamed BP #1 (V0), 5. Unnamed BP #2 (V2+), 6. Unnamed BP #3 (V1), 7. Unnamed BP #4 (V3), 8. Unnamed BP #5 (V2), 9. Unnamed BP #6 (V0), 10. Unnamed BP #7 (V0), 11. Boxcar Boulder Problem (V4), 11a. Boxcar's Low Traverse (V5), 11b. Extended Boxcar Traverse (V6)

content.description: Start with your hands in the middle of the smile like feature, pop for the V-shaped feature directly above and top out. Despite the grade in the book I found this to be substantially harder than Unnamed BP #4 just to the left.
content.location:
Start in the middle of the smile like feature on the right side of the Boxcar boudler.                

The Blasted Rock and Boxcar Boulder: 1. Blasted Rock (V1), 1a. Blasted Rock Variation (V0), 1b. Blasted Rock Variation (V0), 2. Blasted Rock Slab (V0), 3. Boxcar Arete (V8), 4. Unnamed BP #1 (V0), 5. Unnamed BP #2 (V2+), 6. Unnamed BP #3 (V1), 7. Unnamed BP #4 (V3), 8. Unnamed BP #5 (V2), 9. Unnamed BP #6 (V0), 10. Unnamed BP #7 (V0), 11. Boxcar Boulder Problem (V4), 11a. Boxcar's Low Traverse (V5), 11b. Extended Boxcar Traverse (V6)

content.description: Start with your hands on the left side of the smile like feature, pop for the lip and top out.  Despite its sloping appearance, there's a good lip to wrap your fingers around up top.  I actually found this to be easier than the Unnamed BP #5 just to the right.
content.location:
Start on the left side of the smile like feature on the right side of the Boxcar boudler.                

The Blasted Rock and Boxcar Boulder: 1. Blasted Rock (V1), 1a. Blasted Rock Variation (V0), 1b. Blasted Rock Variation (V0), 2. Blasted Rock Slab (V0), 3. Boxcar Arete (V8), 4. Unnamed BP #1 (V0), 5. Unnamed BP #2 (V2+), 6. Unnamed BP #3 (V1), 7. Unnamed BP #4 (V3), 8. Unnamed BP #5 (V2), 9. Unnamed BP #6 (V0), 10. Unnamed BP #7 (V0), 11. Boxcar Boulder Problem (V4), 11a. Boxcar's Low Traverse (V5), 11b. Extended Boxcar Traverse (V6)

content.description: This route may not have a real name, but it's a lot more fun than many that do.  Start sitting on the left side of a rock buried in the ground at the base of the Boxcar boulder with your hands on the upward and right sloping rail.  Work your way up the holds to top out above and right.
content.location:
On the left side of a large rock half buried at the base of the Boxcar boulder.                

The Blasted Rock and Boxcar Boulder: 1. Blasted Rock (V1), 1a. Blasted Rock Variation (V0), 1b. Blasted Rock Variation (V0), 2. Blasted Rock Slab (V0), 3. Boxcar Arete (V8), 4. Unnamed BP #1 (V0), 5. Unnamed BP #2 (V2+), 6. Unnamed BP #3 (V1), 7. Unnamed BP #4 (V3), 8. Unnamed BP #5 (V2), 9. Unnamed BP #6 (V0), 10. Unnamed BP #7 (V0), 11. Boxcar Boulder Problem (V4), 11a. Boxcar's Low Traverse (V5), 11b. Extended Boxcar Traverse (V6)

content.description: The book gives this problem a grade of V1, but it's at least V2 if not harder.  Start sitting with your hand on the rail that slopes upward and right from the left side of the Boxcar boulder.  Do not continue up the rail.  Shoot up and right to a sloping hold.  Top out at the large rectangular block.
content.location:
Start sitting with your hand on the rail that slopes upward and right from the left side of the Boxcar boulder.                

The Blasted Rock and Boxcar Boulder: 1. Blasted Rock (V1), 1a. Blasted Rock Variation (V0), 1b. Blasted Rock Variation (V0), 2. Blasted Rock Slab (V0), 3. Boxcar Arete (V8), 4. Unnamed BP #1 (V0), 5. Unnamed BP #2 (V2+), 6. Unnamed BP #3 (V1), 7. Unnamed BP #4 (V3), 8. Unnamed BP #5 (V2), 9. Unnamed BP #6 (V0), 10. Unnamed BP #7 (V0), 11. Boxcar Boulder Problem (V4), 11a. Boxcar's Low Traverse (V5), 11b. Extended Boxcar Traverse (V6)

content.description: Start on good holds on the left side of the boulder, traverse the lip using horrible crimps and tricky heel-hooks. Top out on the right side of the boulder.
content.location: About 30 feet to the right of the Boxcar boulder, there is an egg-shaped boulder that is maybe 5 feet high.

content.description: Start with your hands underclinging the sharp arete that rises up and right.  Use any thing that you can get your hands, feet, knees or hips on to ascend up to and over the nose.  You're not free yet.  Hump your way over the nose to the top out to complete your escape.
content.location:
The left side of the Blasted Rock.                

The Blasted Rock in the Boxcar Area: 1. Drifter's Escape (V2), 2. Blasted Rock Crack (V0), 3. Blasted Rock (V1), 3a. Blasted Rock Variation (V0), 3b. Blasted Rock Variation (V0), 4. Blasted Rock Slab (V0), 5. Boxcar Arete (V8)

content.description: Start with your hands on the two chalky left facing holds a few feet to the right of the Boxcar boulder arete.  Climb up through the triangular flake to the top of the boulder.  In my opinion, adding the top out pushes the grade above V0.
content.location:
Start on the two chalky left facing holds a few feet to the right of the Boxcar boulder arete.                

The Blasted Rock and Boxcar Boulder: 1. Blasted Rock (V1), 1a. Blasted Rock Variation (V0), 1b. Blasted Rock Variation (V0), 2. Blasted Rock Slab (V0), 3. Boxcar Arete (V8), 4. Unnamed BP #1 (V0), 5. Unnamed BP #2 (V2+), 6. Unnamed BP #3 (V1), 7. Unnamed BP #4 (V3), 8. Unnamed BP #5 (V2), 9. Unnamed BP #6 (V0), 10. Unnamed BP #7 (V0), 11. Boxcar Boulder Problem (V4), 11a. Boxcar's Low Traverse (V5), 11b. Extended Boxcar Traverse (V6)

climbs.name: The Boxcar Boulder Problem (aka Boxcar Traverse)

content.description:
Start on the left side of the boxcar boulder on a decent pinch and a ledge. Traverse right. Although after speaking to many climbers on Carriage Road, I have been told that the original traverse went right to left, dealing with the crux first and finishing through an easy traverse. The grade stays the same either way.

 There is an extension of the traverse called "Easy Street", V9/10, which traverses right to left straight into Boxcar Arete.
Climb the left arete of the Boxcar boulder. Crux is the topout.
The Blasted Rock Slab is a fun change of pace.  There is a small diagonal hold at the right-hand side of the Blasted Rock.  Start with both hands here and climb the slab to the top out.
content.location:
At the far right side of the Blasted Rock.                

The Blasted Rock in the Boxcar Area: 1. Drifter's Escape (V2), 2. Blasted Rock Crack (V0), 3. Blasted Rock (V1), 3a. Blasted Rock Variation (V0), 3b. Blasted Rock Variation (V0), 4. Blasted Rock Slab (V0), 5. Boxcar Arete (V8)

content.description: Climb the Blasted Rock along the big vertical crack that runs through it.  Use the face and corner as necessary to top out.
content.location:
Center of the Blasted Rock.                

The Blasted Rock in the Boxcar Area: 1. Drifter's Escape (V2), 2. Blasted Rock Crack (V0), 3. Blasted Rock (V1), 3a. Blasted Rock Variation (V0), 3b. Blasted Rock Variation (V0), 4. Blasted Rock Slab (V0), 5. Boxcar Arete (V8)

content.description:
Start on the well chalked hold in the center of the black face of the Blasted Rock.  Work up the thin holds to top out without using either arete.  Even if you usually cruise V1, this problem is well worth a go. 

  By using the aretes, the difficulty drops to V0, but it's worth scaling the problem using the right arete and the left arete separately.
content.location:
On the black face of the Blasted Rock.                

The Blasted Rock in the Boxcar Area: 1. Drifter's Escape (V2), 2. Blasted Rock Crack (V0), 3. Blasted Rock (V1), 3a. Blasted Rock Variation (V0), 3b. Blasted Rock Variation (V0), 4. Blasted Rock Slab (V0), 5. Boxcar Arete (V8)

content.description: Start sitting down hugging the two low holds. Use dropknees, slaps, heelhooks and more heelhooks to get to the good hold about 6 feet high. From there, climb a seam to the top.
content.location: A bit before the Baby Hole, below the Carriage Road there are a couple boulders. The problem is on the North-East side of the one further from the road.

content.description: Start sitting down on a good edge. Make one move to the lip. The topout on the slopey lip is the crux. Using the left arete would bring the grade down to V0-.
content.location: Small boulder, between the Baby Hole cave and Blasted Rock. Start on a solid edge a few feet off the ground, on the side facing the Carriage Road.

content.description: Climb down into the depression on the right-hand side of the baby boulder.  Start with your hands on the two chalky holds in the horizontal and climb up the vertical crack and face to the top out.  This is a lot of fun, but probably a little easier than the V3 grade that it garners in the guide.
content.location:
The Baby Hole is located on the Baby boulder at the start of the Boxcar Area.                

A panoramic view of the Boxcar Area.  There's quite a bit of distortion, but hopefully, this will give you an idea of where the various boulders are.

content.description: With more than 30 problems, there is a whole day's worth of bouldering in the Boxcar area.  No matter what your level there is a great climb or two to test your ability: Blasted Rock (V1), Drifter's Escape (V2), Baby Hole (V3), The Boxcar Boulder Problem (V4), Boxcar Arete (V8), Fly Like an Ego (V9), Little Death (V10).
